Topic.Title: The cup-and-handle pattern has been broken

Message.Msg: The long-run or ultimate destination of a stock is driven mostly by the fundamentals. The path it travels to get there is driven by institutions, HTF and quants (statistical algo HTFs and analytical algo institutional) who create the supply and demand. Retail investors have very little if any effect on the movement of stocks that trade with any volume.

Message.Title: OPTIONS - READ BELOW - DUH!
Message.Msg: Effects of Dividends on Call Options Extrinsic value of Call Options are deflated due to dividends not only because of an expected reduction in the price of the stock but also due to the fact that call options buyers do not get paid the dividends that the stock buyers do. This makes call options of dividend paying stocks less attractive to own than the stocks itself, thereby depressing its extrinsic value. How much the value of call options drop due to dividends is really a function of its moneyness. In the money call options with high delta would be expected to drop the most on ex-date while out of the money call options with lower delta would be least affected. This is also why many options traders exercise their deep in the money call options with close to zero extrinsic value just before the dividend payout date if they are trading American Style Options. Exercising the call options for the dividends will help to preserve the value of the position as the dividends recieved offsets the drop in price of the stock. Effects of Dividends on Put Options The stock market never gives away money for free. If a stock is expected to drop by a certain amount, that drop would already have been priced into the extrinsic value of its put options way beforehand. There is no free lunch in options trading. This is what happens to put options of dividend paying stocks. This effect is again a function of options moneyness but this time, in the money put options raise in extrinsic value more than out of the money put options. This is because in the money put options with delta of close to -1 would gain almost dollar or dollar on the drop of a stock. As such, in the money put options would rise in extrinsic value almost as much as the dividend rate itself while out of the money put options may not experience any changes since the dividend effect may not be strong enough to bring the stock down to take those out of the money put options in the money. Another justification for the higher extrinsic value of put options on dividend stocks is due to the fact that if you are short a dividend paying stock, you would be expected to pay back the dividends declared while no such payback is needed if you own its put options instead. This makes owning put options on dividend paying stocks more desirable than shorting the stocks itself.

Message.Title: justIn: apple suppliers see the best july on record as they prepare for largest launch in history
Message.Msg: A basket of Apple suppliers responsible for delivering parts for the iPhone maker's future products witnessed their best monthly sales jump last month, a trend financial experts are attributing to the ramp up for a series of new iOS gadgets that will combine for the 'biggest second-half product launches' in the company's history. In a research report to clients Thursday, Topeka Capital Markets analyst Brian White said preliminary July sales from the firm's proprietary 'Apple Monitor' rose by an estimated 14% month-over-month, or nearly twice the average increase of 8.5% seen over the past seven years. The analytical tool tracks sales trends across the Taiwan supply chain at leading Apple suppliers that generate a high percentage of revenues from the Cupertino-based company. It's used to augment White's own checks and research, rather than as a standalone tool, as new product launches and inventory adjustments can sometimes skew monthly results. "This July represents the strongest month-over-month sales growth of any July we have on record over the past eight years for the Apple Monitor," White said. "[It] was well above the 7% growth experienced last July, supporting our view of an earlier launch of the iPhone 5 versus the iPhone 4S last October." In particular, the analyst said the data is indicative of several new products that are beginning to ramp up at Apple's manufacturing facilities, setting the tone for what he calls "the biggest second-half product launch in Apple's history," and what some other industry watchers further believe will represent the largest electronics product launches of all time.

Message.Title: Apple suppliers see best July on record
Message.Msg: buy my putz Apple suppliers see best July on record as they prepare for 'largest launch in history' By Kasper Jade Published: 08:36 AM EST (05:36 AM PST) A basket of Apple suppliers responsible for delivering parts for the iPhone maker's future products witnessed their best monthly sales jump last month, a trend financial experts are attributing to the ramp up for a series of new iOS gadgets that will combine for the 'biggest second-half product launches' in the company's history. In a research report to clients Thursday, Topeka Capital Markets analyst Brian White said preliminary July sales from the firm's proprietary 'Apple Monitor' rose by an estimated 14% month-over-month, or nearly twice the average increase of 8.5% seen over the past seven years. The analytical tool tracks sales trends across the Taiwan supply chain at leading Apple suppliers that generate a high percentage of revenues from the Cupertino-based company. It's used to augment White's own checks and research, rather than as a standalone tool, as new product launches and inventory adjustments can sometimes skew monthly results. "This July represents the strongest month-over-month sales growth of any July we have on record over the past eight years for the Apple Monitor," White said. "[It] was well above the 7% growth experienced last July, supporting our view of an earlier launch of the iPhone 5 versus the iPhone 4S last October."

Rather, the modification—which comes in the form of the occasional waiver— is a response to the many states seeking more control over how they administer their welfare program. Topic.Title: forbes call attacks on obama turning welfare requirements to states

Message.Msg: Romney’s ad says, "Under Obama’s plan (for welfare), you wouldn’t have to work and wouldn’t have to train for a job. They just send you your welfare check." That's a drastic distortion of the planned changes to Temporary Assistance to Needy Families. By granting waivers to states, the Obama administration is seeking to make welfare-to-work efforts more successful, not end them. What’s more, the waivers would apply to individually evaluated pilot programs -- HHS is not proposing a blanket, national change to welfare law. The ad tries to connect the dots to reach this zinger: "They just send you your welfare check." The HHS memo in no way advocates that practice. In fact, it says the new policy is "designed to improve employment outcomes for needy families." politifact..."The ad’s claim is not accurate, and it inflames old resentments about able-bodied adults sitting around collecting public assistance. Pants on Fire!"

Message.Title: Apple Stores Now Price Matching iPhone Discounts
Message.Msg: As rumors about the next iPhone swirl, Apple has started matching the discounted iPhone prices from other major retailers and carriers. If you walk into one of Apple's retail stores right now with your sights set on an iPhone, be sure to mention Sprint's recent iPhone price drop. According to MacRumors, Apple's retail stores have been given authorization to match the discounted price other retailers are offering. Upon request, Cupertino will discount the iPhone 4S and iPhone 4 models by $49.01. This brings the price of the iPhone 4S down to $349.99 for the 64GB model, $249.99 for 32GB, and $149.99 for 16GB. The iPhone 4, meanwhile, will run you just $49.99 with the discount. Consumers will need to specifically ask for this discount, and will likely need to cite the source offering the lower pricing. Further, the price-matching policy is only in effect at Apple's retail stores, and is not available for orders through the online store. Take note though. If you're looking to get the latest and greatest iPhone model you might want to hold off for a month or so. Apple is reportedly planning to debut its next-generation device at a special event on Sept. 12 and release the phone nine days later, on Sept. 21. At that point, the iPhone 4S will likely get a larger price drop, too. Meanwhile, Apple on Thursday unveiled its annual back-to-school discount, offering students a $100 gift card to spend on apps after they purchase a qualifying Mac through Sept. 21. Also, you can now get a $50 discount off the new iPad $489.99 at Amazon Marketplace if you're willing to buy one that has been refurbished

Topic.Title: Apple's closing price on 8/9.

Message.Msg: That's what they do at close before ex-div date: they reset the stock price and closing price down by the amount of the dividend. This emulates the paying of the dividend from the market cap. Of course, that's not where the money comes from, but ultimately it should decrease the valuation by exactly that much, so they force the issue. Then they see how the market reacts. In this case, the market saw that AAPL deserves to have the higher share price anyway, so back it came. If any of you doubt this, I have plenty of links that I cannot post here. Just do a Google search for "do dividends reset stock price" and follow the link to ehito dot com for an explanation of what happened last night. Thompson

The New iPhone5 and New iPad Mini will be strong catalysts -- with both expected to launch within approx. 6 mos. The iTV launch (possibly by the Holiday Buying Season) will tie the entire APPLE ECOSYSTEM together in the comfort of your living room. As icing on the cake, how about a 6 for 1 split? A stock split would broaden the base of retail investors, and I sincerely believe it is a good idea for a company to "manage" their share price. It is an especially good idea for APPLE because there are so very many young investors (just getting started) that wish to invest too. INVEST in AAPL for the LONG-TERM The S&P 500 Index P&F Chart Price Target is a bullish 1,550. Counting the candlesticks, I estimate it will take 3 to 5 mos. to reach 1,550. On a side note, XOM's P&F Chart Price Target was recently raised from $99 to $105 after breaching resistance to the upside. If NatGas prices move higher on demand as a surface fuel (for truck fleets) and an expansion of export of LNG, then XOM could reach $120 in 10 to 12 mos. as the #1 Top Producer of NatGas in the United States.
